alert.note: Alert for Apache; Navajo (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 31 at 11:58PM MST until August 01 at 3:00AM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: The National Weather Service in Flagstaff has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... northeastern Navajo County in north central Arizona... northwestern Apache County in northeastern Arizona... * Until 300 AM MST. * At 1155 PM MST, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain from Chilchinbito northward to Kayenta, Monument Valley and Dennehotso. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life-threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life-threatening flash flooding of low-water crossings, creeks, normally dry washes and roads. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Kayenta, Chilchinbito, Monument Valley Visitors Center and Dennehotso. This includes the following highways... Highway 160 between mile markers 392 and 420. Highway 163 between mile markers 394 and 416. This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... Cutfoot Wash, Oraibi Wash, Laguna Creek, Tyende Creek, Parrish Creek, Burro Wash and Capitan Wash. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
